channel.title: BBC News - World
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Aukus: China denounces US-UK-Australia pact as irresponsible
item.description: The alliance will allow Australia to build and deploy nuclear-powered submarines for the first time.

item.title: Afghanistan's singers flee Taliban violence
item.description: The BBC spoke with six singers who crossed to Pakistan illegally and are now living in hiding.

item.title: Covid-19: France suspends 3,000 unvaccinated health workers
item.description: The country has made Covid-19 vaccination mandatory for all healthcare and care home workers.

item.title: Head of Islamic State in Sahara killed by French troops - Macron
item.description: French President Emmanuel Macron calls the killing of Adnan Abu Walid al-Sahrawi a "major success".

item.title: Vincent Van Gogh: Newly discovered drawing goes on display
item.description: Study for Worn Out has been sitting in a Dutch family's private collection for more than a century.

item.title: US general defends 'secret' phone calls with China
item.description: Gen Mark Milley allegedly phoned Beijing to "reassure" them amid concern about President Trump.

item.title: Brussels to name street after murdered sex worker Eunice Osayande
item.description: The city aims to draw attention to victims of sexual violence after Eunice Osayande's death in 2018.

item.title: Hezbollah brings Iranian fuel into Lebanon to ease shortages
item.description: Lebanon's economic collapse has left the country dangerously short of fuel and electricity.

item.title: French storms: Nine drown in choppy Mediterranean sea
item.description: Those who drowned in the dangerous conditions were all in their 50s, 60s and 70s.

item.title: Wikipedia blames pro-China infiltration for bans
item.description: The infiltration threatened the "very foundations of Wikipedia", BBC News is told.

item.title: Denmark set to ban life-term prisoners from new romantic links
item.description: The ban comes after a 17-year-old admitted to a romantic relationship with murderer Peter Madsen.

item.title: Nicki Minaj: Trinidad minister criticises rapper's vaccine tweet
item.description: The singer has been accused of spreading vaccine disinformation on the social media site.

item.title: Alex Murdaugh: The hot shot US lawyer and the hit man
item.description: Months after his wife and son were found dead, police say a lawyer arranged a hit - on himself.

item.title: Is Aukus pact a power shift in Asia Pacific?
item.description: The agreement will increase Western presence in the region, amid concerns about China's growing influence.

item.title: Covid: The lives upended by Australia's sealed border
item.description: Eighteen months after Australia shut its border, people reveal tales of separation and despair.

item.title: Canada election: Lytton fire puts village at centre of debate
item.description: A village in western Canada recorded the country's highest-ever temperature. The next day it was gone.

item.title: How Morocco's king dealt a blow to political Islam
item.description: Shocking election results reveal how King Mohammed VI has survived the Arab Spring and its aftermath.

item.title: On the trail of fake medicine smugglers in Benin
item.description: Since the beginning of the pandemic, there’s been an increase in counterfeit drugs around the world.

item.title: North Korea reveals train-launched missile system
item.description: North Korean state media has unveiled what appears to be a new rail-based ballistic missile system.

item.title: Canadian prairie ranchers struggle with drought conditions
item.description: Amid a severe drought in the Prairies, some ranchers are trying to find ways to work with nature.

item.title: Ros Atkins on... why people are using a horse drug
item.description: Ivermectin is being used by some to treat Covid-19, despite the benefits being unproven.

item.title: The homemakers breaking taboos on Instagram
item.description: Vasanti, Ritu and Pradnya, who have overcome huge challenges, now find joy performing on Instagram.

item.title: Russian elections: Meet the politicians barred from the ballot
item.description: Ahead of this week's elections many opposition candidates have been prevented from running.
